fields.headline: Summer days out
fields.bodyText: · See what strange creatures are lurking underwater in Pond Monsters day at Leith Hall, Huntly, Aberdeenshire, on 13 August at 2.30pm (01330 844651). National Trust for Scotland rangers will take groups pond-dipping and explain what goes on in the weird world of waterlife. Wellies are recommended, booking required and entrance is £2.50 (adults free). · The traditional Lakeland Country Fair, Torver, Cumbria (01229 837680) on 18 August offers everything from sheep shearing and ferret racing to Cumberland wrestling, fell racing, tug of war, Lakeland crafts and a children's pet show. · Tall ships will sail in from Spain for a maritime extravaganza in Portsmouth, 15-18 August, at Gunwharf Quays, the Historic Dockyard and Royal Clarence Yard, Gosport (tourist info 023 9282 6722). The culmination of the Cutty Sark Tall Ships race from Alicante is an excuse for four days of street entertainment and children's shows before Sunday's parade of sail and salute by the RAF's Red Arrows. Free. · Early birds catch the balloon at the Northampton Festival (01604 238791) at the Northampton Racecourse, 16-18 August. From 6am, 90 hot air balloons will be available for rides. The festival proper begins at midday: motorbike and Wild West displays, a civil war encampment and funfair rides. The evening is concert time, with an Elvis theme on the anniversary of his death Friday, and then there's a spectacular balloon display. Entrance is free, parking starts at £2. · Puppet shows, music and dancing will feature in the Children's Day at Finsbury Park, London, 18 August (020 7263 5001). · Receive a free copy of Lets Go with the Children 2002. The first 15 Escape readers to email their names and addresses to the publishers at enquiries@cubepublications.co.uk will receive the nearest English regional version of the guide book.
